title: Standup Comedy - Aziz Ansari - Intimate Moments For A Sensual Ev
description:
Aziz Ansari - Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening - 2010

Review	by David Jeffries

If youÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re unfamiliar with the standup of the wicked funny actor/comedian Aziz Ansari, imagine a Mitch Hedberg tape sped up three ticks and then add an extra helping of snide to the routine, along with Internet-age nerdiness and some deviant ideas that are absolutely unquotable in mixed company. HereÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s hoping no one misses the irony of the albumÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s title, because Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening stacks the rape jokes high, but AzizÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s act is, fortunately, much more than filthy. ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œHarassing Harris on FacebookÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ wouldnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t be nearly as funny if it werenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t for the man's keen ability to put the listener in a paranoid preteen mindset while the insults thrown at MTV are razor-sharp, skewering the contestants of Aziz's most hated show, Next. Hipsters, social network addicts, and those who practice shroomery will get the most out of the manÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s thoroughly modern set, but you only need a passing knowledge of Kanye West and R. Kelly to belly laugh at the outstanding fourth quarter. Anyone who appreciates observational humor at breakneck speed must hear the comedianÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s re-creation of an R. Kelly club appearance, and if that werenÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t enough, AzizÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s over the top ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œRAAAAAAAANDYÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ character from the film Funny People provides the encore, which brings down the house. Providing every reason why Kanye West and Judd Apatow are both big fans, this is a fantastic, uproarious debut.
